formattedAddress: 15 Union Square W, New York, NY 10003, USA
adrFormatAddress: 15 Union Square W, New York, NY 10003, USA

editorialSummary.text: Meticulously prepared Chinese fusion cuisine served in a stylish setting with a glass ceiling.

originalText.text: A great place for some dim sum and stir fry! The interior and atmosphere is superior and the Chinese food has both authenticity and innovation. My friend and I ordered some dim sum, veggies and pancakes. All tastes good. Would definitely recommend for friend and family gatherings!

text.text: A great place for some dim sum and stir fry! The interior and atmosphere is superior and the Chinese food has both authenticity and innovation. My friend and I ordered some dim sum, veggies and pancakes. All tastes good. Would definitely recommend for friend and family gatherings!

originalText.text: I’m always surprised this place isn’t more crowded. Xu’s serves up classic dim sum dishes like egg custard buns, shumai, and roast pork buns in inventive twists and an elevated environment. The Snow White roast pork buns are must orders.

text.text: I’m always surprised this place isn’t more crowded. Xu’s serves up classic dim sum dishes like egg custard buns, shumai, and roast pork buns in inventive twists and an elevated environment. The Snow White roast pork buns are must orders.

originalText.text: I don’t know why this place isn’t more crowded on weekdays for lunch. The $15 lunch special comes with soup and entree and food is really good here! We had the hot and sour soup to start. Perfect blend of heat from the chilis and the vinegary goodness… complete with some pickled veg. For lunch we had the mapo and Buddhas delight to split. Both were really tasty and healthy portions (took some home). The Buddhas delight had a fantastic assortment of veg including snow fungus and wood ear mushrooms which I love! The lunch special is a great deal, but also the food here is just solid, and worth spending the extra money for dinner too.

text.text: I don’t know why this place isn’t more crowded on weekdays for lunch. The $15 lunch special comes with soup and entree and food is really good here! We had the hot and sour soup to start. Perfect blend of heat from the chilis and the vinegary goodness… complete with some pickled veg. For lunch we had the mapo and Buddhas delight to split. Both were really tasty and healthy portions (took some home). The Buddhas delight had a fantastic assortment of veg including snow fungus and wood ear mushrooms which I love! The lunch special is a great deal, but also the food here is just solid, and worth spending the extra money for dinner too.

originalText.text: This trendy place is nicely built, and it was spacious.  I came here for lunch, and the service was good.   Food prices in general were pretty high here.   It focuses on Cantonese food with some dimsum options, some Chinese take out food and some Szechuan selection.   The wonton noodle dish was good, except the wontons were a little weak.  Pot stickers were good and filling!

text.text: This trendy place is nicely built, and it was spacious.  I came here for lunch, and the service was good.   Food prices in general were pretty high here.   It focuses on Cantonese food with some dimsum options, some Chinese take out food and some Szechuan selection.   The wonton noodle dish was good, except the wontons were a little weak.  Pot stickers were good and filling!

originalText.text: Terribly disappointing experience.  I rarely take the time to post a review but I actually feel a responsibility to alert everyone to STAY AWAY from this restaurant!  The only thing this place has going for it is that the decor is somewhat nice,  especially upon first entering. However once we got inside and got settled it was actually far too hot and we asked several times for them to turn down the heat. The rest of the experience went downhill from there.  The service was terrible:  it took several attempts to get their attention to order.  When they brought out one of our appetizers,  which was supposed to be 'fried pork dumplings',  we noticed a strong fish odor.  Since that was not what we were interested in eating,  and the smell was very unpleasant,  we put dish to the side.  Then the server came over to inquire if there was a problem,  and we explained that it smelled like fish.  He told us that they had simply gone ahead and added shrimp to the dish, which was astonishingly irresponsible given that it could have triggered someone's allergies.  They took the food back,  apologized and gave us a credit for that dish.  The next problem arose when they brought only one entree,  not the other one.  I waited a long time without eating my own food to be polite to my son who had not yet been brought his dish.  After at least another 10 minutes passed we had to try to flag down a waiter to ask about the second dish.  It almost seemed as though they had forgotten about us.  In fact,  the whole wait staff seemed to be in a kind of trance.  The second dish -- which was supposed to be 'garlic marinated spare ribs' -- finally arrived.  However it did not appear to be marinated in anyway.  Instead it was dried and breaded and not at all fresh.  To top it all off,  the prices for this terrible meal were too high. Finally,  the women's bathroom is in a state of disrepair,  with an exposed wall where the 'flushing' handle should be,  and dirty floors.  Overall,  we came away angry,  still hungry,  and deeply disappointed.  Save your money and your health and stay away.
